Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Animal pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with three added white bands; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of cock (parts of tail, wing feathers and legs remaining), to left; below in handle zone, two brown bands above double saw-edged pattern flanked by verticals.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern, see Lemos 1991, no. 1605 from Berezan. Lemos places this sherd in Stage 2 of the Black Figure Animal Chalice Group. The vases in this group are all made by the same artist, the composition is well-balanced and the images are precise. Incision is used in all the same places. It ought to be noted, however, that there are different incision marks on British Museum 1888,0601.549, which Lemos also includes in this group.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 165, p. 173, p. 331, no. 1594, pl. 204)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1245) (phase 2)
